intro: Randia griffithii, commonly known as the redroot randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white or pinkish flowers. Its roots are often reddish in color, giving it its common name. Randia griffithii is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
